sub_headline: Supreme court strikes down same-sex marriage bans
headline: You can marry whomever you want
blurb: The court rules in a 5-4 vote that states can’t deny gay people marriage rights afforded to heterosexual couples, legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide. About 123,000 such marriages occur within the next year. Obama, who “evolved” on the issue during his presidency, called the decision “a victory for America.”

sub_headline: Violence against women act renewed
headline: You’re better protected against domestic abuse
blurb: The act, first passed in 1994, had expired in 2011. The law makes it easier to prosecute crimes against women in federal court and provides domestic abuse hotlines, battered women shelters and other services. It’s credited with helping reduce domestic violence more than by 60%.

sub_headline: Obama signs Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act
headline: You're better protected against pay discrimination
blurb: The act gives an employee up to 180 days to challenge any paycheck that reflects unequal pay for equal work, making it easier for workers to sue companies for pay discrimination.

sub_headline: Obama signs Hate Crimes Prevention Act
headline: You're now protected under hate-crime laws
blurb: The act expands hate-crime protections to include attacks based on sexual orientation, disability or gender identity, in addition to previously protected classes of race, ethnicity and religion.

sub_headline: Obama signs credit card reform into law
headline: Credit card companies can't secretly raise your rates
blurb: Credit Card Accountability, Responsibility, and Disclosure Act

sub_headline: Obama signs children's health insurance bill
headline: 4.1 million children like yours got healthcare
blurb: The Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act (CHIP) renewed and expanded the federally funded health care from an estimated 7 million children to 11 million.

sub_headline: Obama signs school lunch law
headline: Kids like yours get healthier school lunches
blurb: The Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act, championed by Michelle Obama, went into action in 2012. A bid to combat childhood obesity, it requires schools to serve more variety and larger portions of fruits and vegetables in school lunches. Some students were less than thrilled with the healthier results.

sub_headline: Obama signs health care reform into law
headline: You're guarenteed healthcare coverage
blurb: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

sub_headline: Obama signs student loans bill
headline: It's easier for you to repay outstanding loans after graduating
blurb: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010,

sub_headline: Obama repeals 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell'
headline: You don't have to hide your orientation in the military

sub_headline: Obama announces education grant program
headline: Your children's teachers may be evaluated more heavily by test scores

sub_headline: Obama boosts fuel efficiency standards
headline: Your next car (purchased after 2025) will have nearly double the fuel economy

sub_headline: Obama signs Gabriella Miller Kids First Research Act
headline: Your tax dollars no longer fund political conventions

sub_headline: Snowden leaks NSA surveillance info
headline: You now know Obama's reading your texts
blurb: June 2 – Obama signs a bill renewing the Patriot Act but including long sought for reforms to surveillance programs.

sub_headline: Obama downplays threat from ISIS ("Jayvee team")
headline: Your fellow Americans are more afraid of a domestic terror attack than ever before

sub_headline: VA Secretary Eric Shinseki resigns amind wait times scandal
headline: If you're sick, you'll have to wait to go to a VA facility — but not as long as you once had to

sub_headline: FCC adopts Obama's net neutrality regulations
headline: Your Internet can't be blocked or throttled by companies

sub_headline: Obama normalizes relations with Cuba
headline: Pack your bags! You're allowed to go to Cuba

sub_headline: Obama expands overtime pay for millions of workers
headline: (If under $47K) You now make time-and-a-half pay for overtime // (If Employer)You now have to pay more of your employees overtime

sub_headline: Obama signs Paris climate agreement
blurb: (and also the Clean Power Plan) ... If you drive a car, your fuel economy standards will be higher. You are likely to get more power from wind and solar. If you live in a coastal area or an area that is prone to flooding/hurricane/drought, the effects of global warming will be slowed. You may end up seeing more electric cars.

sub_headline: Obama's designated 23 monuments
headline: You can visit 3.9 million acres of new national monuments

sub_headline: National debt rises from $10.5 trillion to $19.6 trillion
headline: We can take the debt and divide it by the total population. "Your share of the debt is ___ vs. ___ in 2008." Median wages for a person like you have gone up or down or are stagnant.

sub_headline: Obama raises the refugee ceiling 30%
headline: Your nation welcomes refugees -- big time

sub_headline: Obama launches Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals
headline: You can apply to be in the U.S. legally

sub_headline: Minimum wage and paid Leave (via executive action and a state-and-local strategy)
headline: Green light by Korte.
